p: WEEV is maintained in an enzootic cycle between passerine birds as reservoirs and its specific mosquito vector, Culex tarsalis, abundant in agricultural settings in the western US. Domestic and wild birds are considered important reservoir and epizootic amplifying hosts ( Fig. 5). It has been also suggested that lagomorphs and rodents can serve as amplification hosts when they are infected with WEEV by Aedes mosquitoes [ 10, 44, 79].
